results.title: Metal skin
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Wright, Daniel Scharf, Southern Star Entertainment and Daniel Scharf Productions
results.brief_description: After the controversial success of “Romper Stomper”, Geoffrey Wright’s second feature was a critical and commercial failure. However, this story about four young teenagers who find their only joy and exhileration in drag racing, is a mesmerising study of contemporary working class alienation. Set in Melbourne’s western suburbs the film is a hyper-kinetic study of the fractures and tensions at play in Australian society. The young cast is excellent as is the editing and cinematography.

results.title: Ghost in the shell (D)
results.creator_credit: Mamoru Oshii, Mitsuhisa ishikawa, Ken Iyadomi, Ken Matsumoto, Yoshimasa Mizou, Bondai Visual, Manga Entertainment and Kodonsha
results.brief_description: In the tradition of ‘Akira’, ‘Ghost in the shell’ features excellent animation which will impress. Set in the cyberspace worlds of artificial intelligence and sophisticated computer technology, this violent and complex adventure revolves around a ghostly agent whose job is to determine who is real and who is a cybernetic creation. When a master hacker learns to break into the minds of his victims, the ‘Ghost in the shell’ must foil his evil attempts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mamoru Oshii, Mitsuhisa ishikawa, Ken Iyadomi, Ken Matsumoto, Yoshimasa Mizou, Bondai Visual, Manga Entertainment and Kodonsha

results.title: The Lost weekend
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Charles Brackett and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This classic Hollywood drama scooped the Oscars in 1945 and it is not surprising. Ray Milland is an alcoholic writer who cannot control his binge drinking. Over a torturous weekend we see how the lure of alcohol has destroyed his confidence, his self-respect and his ambition. As it threatens to eat away at his talent, he comes closer and closer to suicidal despair. From a contemporary perspective the moralistic ending may appear trite but what is undeniable is Billy Wilder’s talent at creating a film which seems to visually simulate the terrifying perspective of a drug user’s imagination. Milland too is excellent as a man who is unable to reach the goals he sets himself. As a study of writer’s block, “The Lost Weekend” is both perceptive and illuminating. Jane Wyman appears as his long-suffering lover, however the book’s original narrative linked the writer’s fear of failure to his ambiguous sexuality. An outstanding film. Based on the book by Charles Jackson.

results.title: The White balloon
results.creator_credit: Jafar Panahi, Ferdos Films, Dendy Films and CMI
results.brief_description: This wonderful motion picture is the story of a young Iranian girl’s search for the perfect goldfish to release in her pond to encourage good luck in the New Year. However, when she loses the money her mother has given her, young Razieh and her brother seek their fortunes in modern day Tehran. This visually ravishing contemporary retelling of “The Red Balloon”, reveals much about the culture of the Muslim world. By filming through a child’s eyes, director Jafar Panahi reveals a world of incidental cruelty, a world which often rushes by too fast to listen to the desires of children. There is a darkness in “The White Balloon”, not explicit, but a sadness about the opportunities adults lose in understanding the world of their child. As in all the best fairy-tales, this is a profoundly humane story. The screenplay is by acclaimed director Abbas Kiarostami. Winner of the Camera D’Or at the 1995 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Strawberry and chocolate = fresa y chocolate
results.creator_credit: Juan Carlos Tabio, Tomas Gutierrez Alea, Miguel Mendoza, Tabasco Films, Imcine and Cuban Institute of Arts and Film Industry
results.brief_description: A young Cuban Communist Party cadre is shocked to find himself pursued by a witty, handsome homosexual. By exploring the friendship that develops between a straight man and a gay man in a culture which forbids open expression of homosexuality, “Strawberry and Chocolate” manages to raise important political questions while remaining delightfully comic throughout. The film exposes Cuba’s anti-gay laws by showing the important role gay and lesbian revolutionaries, writers and artists played in Cuban culture and examines how political censorship in any context only impoverishes a society. Jorge Perugorria and Vladimir Cruz are excellent as the two friends and Mirta Ibarra steals every scene she is in as a vivacious and sexy Cuban woman who refuses to allow Latin machismo to dictate her life and choices.

results.title: Jesus of Montreal
results.creator_credit: Denys Arcand, Pierre Gendron, Roger Frappier, National Film Board of Canada and Max Films
results.brief_description: Daniel is a young actor who, like most of his friends, flits from commercials to stage to television trying to find work. Asked to take on a production of the Passion for a local Church, he finds himself increasingly obsessed with the story of Jesus and his redemption on the Cross. Daniel and the young cast begin to create a retelling of the Passion which resonates with a contemporary audience. However, the radical reworking upsets both the Church and the commercial sponsors who are uncomfortable with the interpretation. “Jesus of Montreal” is a sublime and deeply spiritual film. It is to director Denys Arcand’s credit that he has not only made a film that is ravishing to look at and experience but one which is not afraid to ask the big, difficult questions about life, faith and meaning. Winner of the Jury Prize at the Cannes Film Festival. Winner of a Silver Bear at the Berlin Film Festival.

results.title: What's eating Gilbert Grape?
results.creator_credit: Lasse Hallstrom, David Matalon, Bertil Ohlsson, Meir Teper, J and M Entertainment and Matalon Teper Ohlsson Production
results.brief_description: From the acclaimed director of “My life as a dog”, “What’s eating Gilbert Grape?” is a moving and at times comic portrayal of an unusual family in a small town. Gilbert (Johnny Depp) must keep a vigilant eye on his family, particularly his intellectually disabled younger brother Arnie (Leonardo Di Caprio) and his reclusive mother. When a stranger (Juliette Lewis) comes to town, she not only captures his heart, but also turns his life around.

results.title: Riverdance: the new show
results.creator_credit: John McColgan, Moya Doherty, Abhann Productions and Tyrone Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed at Radio City Music Hall, the Irish dance company Riverdance has won acclaim since they entered the Eurovision Song Contest. This program features their new show which toured Australia in 1996. Highlights of the show include “Homecoming”, “Trading Taps” and their classics “Riverdance”, “Thunderstorm” and “Heartland.” Starring principal dancers Jean Butler, Colin Dunne and Maria Pages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McColgan, Moya Doherty, Abhann Productions and Tyrone Productions

results.title: Mr. Holland's opus
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Robert W. Cort, Michael Nolin, Ted Field, PolyGram Film International and Interscope communications
results.brief_description: Richard Dreyfuss plays Glen Holland, a musician who falls into a temporary teaching position at J.F. Kennedy High and stays for 30 years. The opus he composes takes second place to his great work, that of enriching the lives of his students as they pass through his class. This is not a film about a hero who performs brave deeds; but of ordinary people in everyday settings who strive daily for excellence in their lives. Dreyfuss is ably supported by Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas and Olympia Dukakis. “Mr Holland’s opus” is a sentimental, warm film which will uplift the spirit.

results.title: The Anniversary
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Jimmy Sangster and Seven Arts-Hammer Film Productions
results.brief_description: An off-beat, devilish black comedy based on the popular stage play by Bill MacIlwraith. Bette Davis rules the roost as the matriach of a most unusual family. The mother of three grown sons, the one-eyed Mrs Taggart is a relentless dominatrix and will stop at nothing to keep her spineless offspring under her thumb. Although the husband she despised has been dead for ten years, she continues to observe her wedding anniversary by insisting that her sons return home for the celebration. However, this year they arrive with something else on their minds - independence from her grasp. Co-starring Sheila Hancock, Jack Hedley, Christian Roberts, James Cossins and Elaine Taylor.
